gurmukhi: pwn lIE Dnu bwnu sMBwr inhwr keI Air kot sMGwry ] BUpq mo riq sMg rqy muK AMq ko AMqk sy Bt hwry ]1519]
transliteration: Paan Leeo Dhan(u) Baan(u) Sanbhaar Nihaar Kaiar(i) Kot Sanhdare|| Bhoopat Mo Rat(i) San Rate Moukh Ant Ko Antak Se Bhat Hdare||1519||
translation: Taking his bow and arrows in his hands and looking here and there, he killed many enemies; the faces of the warriors fighting with the king became red and ultimately they were all defeated.1519.

gurmukhi: lY Apuny iSv pwn srwsn jI Apuny Aiq kop bFwXo ] BUpq ko icqXo icq mY bD bwhn Awpn ko su DvwXo ]
transliteration: Lai Apoune Shiv Paan Saraasan Jiapoune At(i) Kop Badhaayo|| Bhoopat Ko Chityo Chit Mai Badh Baahan Aapan Ko Su Dhavaayo||
translation: Taking his bow and arrows in his hands, Shiva was extremely enraged; he got his vehicle driven towards the king with the motive of killing him; he shouted loudly to the king;

gurmukhi: mwrq ho Ab Xw rn mY kih kY niRp kau ieh BwNq sunwXo ] XoN kih nwd bjwvq BXo mno AMq BXo prlY Gn AwXo ]1520]
transliteration: Maarat Ho Ab Yaa Ran Mai Kah(i) Kai Nrip Kau Eh Bhaant Sounaayo|| Yon Kah(i) Naad Bajaavat Bhayo Mano Ant Bhayo Parlai|| Ghan Aayo||1520||
translation: “I am just now going to kill you” and saying thus, he raised the dreadful sound of his conch; it appeared that the clouds were thundering on the doomsday.1520.

gurmukhi: nwd su nwd hirE BrpUr sunXo purhUq mhw ibsmwXo ] swq smudR ndI nd Aau sr ibMb sumyr mhw grjwXo ]
transliteration: Naad Su Naad Rahio Bharpoor Sounyo Purhoot Mahaa Bismaayo|| Saat Smudra Nadinad Au Sar Bind Soumer Mahaa Gadjaayo||
translation: That terrible sound pervaded the whole universe and even Indra was wonder-struck on listening to it; the echo of this sound thundered in the seven oceans, streams, tanks and Sumeru mountain etc.;

gurmukhi: kwNp auiTE sun XoN shswnn caudh lokn cwlu jnwXo ] SMkq hÍY sun kY jg ky jn BUp nhI mn mY frpwXo ]1521]
transliteration: Kaanp Outhio Soun Yon Sahsaanan Chaudah Lokan Dhaal(u) Janaayo|| Shankat Hvai Soun Kai Jag Ke Jan Bhoop Nahiman Mai Darpaayo||1521||
translation: Sheshnaga listening to this sound also trembled; he thought that all the fourteen worlds had trembled; the beings of all the worlds, listening to this sound, were bewildered; but the king Kharag Singh was not frightened.1521.
Speech of Kharag Singh addressed to Shiva:

gurmukhi: rudR ky Awnn ko Aivlok kY XoN kih kY niRp bwq sunweI ] kw BXo jo jugIXw kr lY kr ifMB ky kwrn nwd bjweI ]
transliteration: Rudra Ke Aanan Ko Avilok Kai Yon Kah(i) Nrip Baat Sounaaee|| Kaa Bhayo Jao Jougeeyaa Kar Lai Kar Dinbh Ke Kaaran Naad Bajaaee||
translation: Seeing towards Rudra, the king said within his hearing, “O Yogi! what difference your deceit of raising the sound will make?

gurmukhi: qMdul mwNgn hY quX kwrj mY n fro quih cwNp cFweI ] jUJbo kwm hY C`qRn ko kCu jogn ko nhI kwm lrweI ]1522]
transliteration: Tandul Maanad Hai Tuya Kaaraj Mai Na Daro Tuhe Chaanp Chadhaaee|| Joojhbo Kaam Hai Chhattran Ko Kachhu Jogad Ko Nahikaam Laraaee||1522||
translation: “You engage yourself in begging for the alms of rice; I do not fear your archery; only the Kshatrieas are meant to fight, this is not task of Yogis.”1522.

gurmukhi: XO kih kY bqIXw iSv sO niRp qwn ibKY irs KVg bfo lY ] mwrq By hr ky qn mY kib sXwm khY ijX kop mhwN kY ]
transliteration: Yaoun Kah(i) Kai Bateeyaa Shiv Sau Nrip Taan Bikhai Ris Khadag Bad Lai|| Maarat Bhe Har Ke Tan Mai Kabi Syaam Kahai Jiya Kop Mahaan Kai
translation: Saying this, the king took out his large dagger and in anger hurled it on the body of Shiva; after striking the blow of the dagger on the body of Shiva, the king roaring like the sea challenged him;

gurmukhi: Gwau kY suMB kY gwq ibKY iem boil auiTE his isMD jrw jY ] rudR igirE isr mwl khUM mwl khUM khUM bYl igirE igirE sUl khUM hÍY ]1523]
transliteration: Ghaau Kai Sounbh Kai Gadt Bikhai Im Bol(i) Outhio Has(i) Sindh Jaraa Sool Kdhoondhvai||1523||
translation: Shiva fell down with the blow of the dagger; his necklace of skulls slipped and fell down; somewhere his bull fell down and somewhere his trident fell down.1523.
